subject: Ethics
title: Dolly the Sheep's Legacy
description: One-minute skill: Dolly the Sheep's Legacy.

hook.text: In 1996, a lamb born in Scotland changed biology forever. She was a genetic copy of an adult sheep.

buildup.text: Dolly proved mammalian cloning was possible. Scientists took DNA from one sheep and made an identical one.

discovery.text: She was the first mammal cloned from an adult cellâ€”277 attempts failed before she survived.

twist.text: Dolly aged faster than normal and died young from lung disease, raising doubts about cloning's safety.

climax.text: Her birth triggered worldwide debates: if we can clone sheep, humans are next. Are we ready?

punchline.text: Dolly proved we could copy life. She didn't prove we should.

quiz.question: What was scientifically significant about Dolly the sheep?
options: She was the first animal born through IVF
She lived longer than any other sheep in history
She was the first mammal cloned from an adult cell
